thread.title: Paradise or hell? No running water or electricity on world's most crowded island
thread.title_full: Paradise or hell? No running water or electricity on world's most crowded island

title: Paradise or hell? No running water or electricity on world's most crowded island
text:
IG The island is just 0.012 square kilometres 
While there's a very low crime rate, there's no running water, no doctors, no cemetery and only five hours of electricity a day. 
If a resident dies they are are buried on a nearby island. Many of the locals earning a living through tourism. 
You might be surprised to hear there are 90 houses, two shops, a restaurant and a school. 
Talking of travel - did you know it's the 65th anniversary of the package holiday ? Take a look at these vintage snaps. IG Santa Cruz is four times more densely populated than Manhattan 
It's said the tiny island's lack of mosquitoes has made the island incredibly popular, but islanders not completely self-sufficient with the Navy delivering supplies to the island every three weeks. 
Juvenal Julio, 66, is a descendant of the Islote's founders. He told the Toronto Star: "Life here is calm and delightful. 
"We don't have violence, we don't need police, we all know each other and we enjoy our days. It's a glorious life." Related articles
